sen.j: 観世銕之亟 (かんぜ・てつのじょう) は能楽観世流宗家観世家の分家当主がもっぱら明治以降名乗っている名。
sen.e: Tetsunojo KANZE is the name used mostly after Meiji Period, by the head of a branch family of the Kanze family, the leading family of Kanze school of Nohgaku.
Tetsunojo KANZE is the name used mostly after the Meiji period, by the head of a branch family of the Kanze family, the head family of Kanze school of Nohgaku.
sen.cmt: the を挿入しました。Period→period,leading→head と修正しました。
sen.e: Tetsunojo KANZE is the name used mostly after the Meiji period, by the head of a branch family of the Kanze family, the head family of Kanze school of Nohgaku.

sen.j: 家系上は九代目を数える。
sen.e: According to the family tree, it is counted as the ninth.
According to the family tree, it is counted as the ninth.
According to the family tree, it is counted as the ninth.
Origin
Origin
Origin

sen.j: 江戸中期（1752年）に観世流十五世宗家観世元章が弟観世清尚に別家させて成立。
sen.e: In mid Edo period (in 1752), the fifteenth head family of Kanze school, Motoakira Kanze divided his younger brother, Kiyohisa KANZE from the family and established it.
In the mid Edo period (in 1752), Motoakira KANZE, the 15th family head of Kanze school, made his younger brother Kiyohisa KANZE establish a branch family.
sen.cmt: the を挿入しました。 fifteenth→15th,Kanze→KANZE,head family→family head と修正しました。文の流れをスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: In the mid Edo period (in 1752), Motoakira KANZE, the 15th family head of Kanze school, made his younger brother Kiyohisa KANZE establish a branch family.

sen.j: 以降は能楽四流の宗家並みに扱われた。
sen.e: After that, it was treated as the head families of four schools of Nohgaku.
After that, it was treated as much as the head families of four schools of Nohgaku.
sen.cmt: as→as much as と修正しました。
sen.e: After that, it was treated as much as the head families of four schools of Nohgaku.

sen.j: 現在、観世流において「分家」といえば銕之亟家を指す。
sen.e: At present, a 'branch' refers to Tetsunojo family in Kanze school.
At present, a 'branch family' refers to the Tetsunojo family in Kanze school.
sen.cmt: family, the を挿入しました。
sen.e: At present, a 'branch family' refers to the Tetsunojo family in Kanze school.
They preside over "Tessenkai" (an association of Tetsunojo family of Kanze school).
They preside over "Tessenkai" (a Noh performance group led by Tetsunojo Kanze).
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。（用語集を参照しましたが、別に英語でのサイトがありましたのでそれを参考にしています）http://www.lib.city.minato.tokyo.jp/yukari/e/man-detail.cgi?id=33
sen.e: They preside over "Tessenkai" (a Noh performance group led by Tetsunojo Kanze).
